result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward C McMackiel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: 22CM17 but consecutive to any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to have NO Contact w/ M.S.
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen.
Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC.

records.addlTxt: Ct Rptr RL - $76
Transcript of Plea and Sentencing Hearing, July 19, 2022 (Digitally Recorded)
of Requirements and Penalties under Sec. 941.29 & 941.291

1:01 PM Defendant Edward C McMackiel in court, in custody ACJ, but was housed in Columbia.  Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Vincent Rust appeared by video for Edward C McMackiel.   Cases 21CF208, 22CF28, and 22CM17.  Court asking if there is a repeater in 21CF208, State is saying repeater would be dismissed and read in and plead to CT.  The recommendation is for with the repeater status for 21CF208.  
Off record for attorneys to talk.  Attorney and Def in breakout room.  Back on the record at 1:13.  State, the repeater not included in the charge, 3 and half years.  1 and half years initial confinement and two years extended supervision.  
State has complied with victim rights in 22CF28 and 22CM17.  In 21CF208 not applicable for victim rights.  State moves to dismiss repeater and moves to amend to misdemeanor battery 22CF28. 
21CF208 pleads GUILTY
22CF28 pleads GUILTY
22CM17 pleads GUILTY
Court goes over elements.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied def knowingly, willing, and voluntarily is pleading guilty, and accepts.  Attorney and def agree he is a repeater.  Factual basis can rely on criminal compliant from each case, court finds a factual basis exists, finds guilty and direct judgment to enter.  
State comments on sentencing.  Attorney comments on sentencing.  Def comments on sentencing.  Court comments.  
See offer to settle, attached.  
Attorney no credit.
Offer to Settle
Email sent to ACJ w/copy of Tranport Order for July 19 at 1:00;  ka
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:04 PM Defendant Edward C McMackiel in court with attorney Vincent Rust.  Defendant Edward C McMackiel in custody Stanley.  Lynne K Van Hollen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Edward C McMackiel appeared by video means with Attorney. 21CF208,22CF28,22CM17-- asking for a PLEAS. 
JA-- Order to transport, def wants to appr in person. If the def changes his mind Atty needs to let us know.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Def is set up to appear by zoom from Stanley Correctional on June 13;  they will dial into Judge's zoom;  ka
def is set up to appear from Dodge on June 13;  Court will need to dial into IP address 165.189.58.5 Ext 20102

08:20 AM - 22 CF 28, 22 CM 17, 21 CF 208 - Attorney Ruth Diane Kressel appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Vincent Rust appeared by video means for Defendant Edward C McMackiel. Defendant Edward C McMackiel appeared by video means (fr Dodge).  COVID - ZOOM;  22 CF 28 - PH today, OFF Record for Atty/def to talk, Bk on Record @ 8:26 am, WOPH, given rt to PH, Ct finds PC to bel def com fel in Ash Co, bound over for argnmt, info filed, rec'd copy info, waives read, plea N/G.  All cases set for STC.  Def will be in custody next hring.  JA arrange for def to appear, Atty adv'd if def moved elsewhere to let JA know ASAP so new arrangmts can be made.
